descriptionSmall: Also known as LittleFinger, beyond his official duties, he is the eyes and ears of King's Landing.
descriptionLarge: Nakedly ambitious, Littlefinger left the Small Council to marry Lysa Arryn and secure the Vale to the Lannister's side. Beyond his official duties, he is the eyes and ears of King's Landing along with Varys.
The youngest of Cersei’s children, Tommen inherited the throne after the death of his brother Joffrey.
Jaqen helped Arya escape from Harrenhal and provided her with an iron coin to ensure her safe passage to Braavos.

descriptionSmall: The playwright of a traveling company.
descriptionLarge: The playwright of a traveling company who wrote and directs “The Bloody Hand,” a theatrical production of The War of Five Kings currently running in Braavos. Izembaro also stars as Robert Baratheon and Tywin Lannister.

Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, Cersei is fiercely protective of her three children. Even before she was married to Robert Baratheon, she was involved in a relationship with her twin brother, Jaime. Like her father, Cersei is interested in maintaining her position of power.

Cersei's twin brother and the Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, it was he who slew the Mad King in violation of his oath to protect the royal family. After Jaime was captured by Catelyn Stark, Brienne of Tarth escorted him back to King's Landing. Jaime lost his sword hand to Roose Bolton's henchman, Locke, along the way.

descriptionSmall: The youngest son of Lord Tywin Lannister.
descriptionLarge: What Tyrion lacks in size and strength, he makes up for in mental acuity. Formerly Hand of the King and Master of Coin on the Small Council, Tyrion has now made his way to Meereen.

A Red priestess from Asshai, Melisandre worships the Lord of Light. Her visions have told her that Stannis is the true king and as his advisor, she has encouraged him to pursue the throne at all costs.
Formerly a slave in Astapor, Missandei is fluent in the Common Tongue and High Valyrian.

The son of Lord Commander Jeor Mormont, he lives in exile in Essos acting as an advisor to Daenerys Targaryen. Although Jorah originally joined Dany's company to spy on her, he has since become devoted to her.
Leader of a Dothraki horde.

descriptionSmall: A lieutenant in the Second Sons.
descriptionLarge: Daenerys' advisor and lover.

descriptionSmall: Lord of the Dreadfort and head of House Bolton.
descriptionLarge: Lord of the Dreadfort and head of House Bolton, Roose takes pride in his family's sigil of a flayed man. A proven soldier who joined Robb Stark on the battlefield, Lord Bolton subsequently betrayed him to gain favor with Tywin Lannister.
A former soldier haunted by the atrocities he committed on the battlefield, Brother Ray is a septon of boundless compassion and kindness.
Lover of Prince Oberyn Martell, she witnessed his death at the hands of the Mountain.
Half-Dornish and elegant, she uses the whip as her weapon of choice.

descriptionSmall: The eldest of Oberyn Martell's bastard daughters.
descriptionLarge: The eldest of Oberyn Martell's bastard daughters, Obara is as dangerous with a spear as he was.

descriptionSmall: The youngest of the Sand Snakes.
descriptionLarge: The youngest of the Sand Snakes, Tyene is proficient with daggers.
A reformed smuggler, it was Davos who provided Stannis' forces much-needed provisions during the long siege of Storm's End. He serves as Hand to King Stannis.

Ned Stark's bastard son, Jon joined the Night's Watch. On a mission for Lord Commander Mormont, Jon infiltrated the wildlings by pretending to forsake his Night Watch brothers. In doing so, he fell in love with Ygritte, a wildling woman.

descriptionSmall: A bastard son of Roose Bolton.
descriptionLarge: A bastard son of Roose Bolton, Ramsay's bloodlust is even stronger than his father's. After taking Winterfell, he captured Theon Greyjoy and slowly tortured him into submission.

descriptionSmall: The younger of the Stark daughters.
descriptionLarge: The younger of the Stark daughters, Arya has put her survival skills to use making her way east to the city of Braavos.

descriptionSmall: Bran is traveling north with his bannermen Jojen and Meera Reed.
descriptionLarge: Crippled after Jaime Lannister pushed him from a tower, Bran travels north to seek answers about his visions.

descriptionSmall: A highborn lady who would rather be a knight.
descriptionLarge: Brienne is a highborn lady who would rather be a knight. As Catelyn Stark's envoy, she escorted Jaime Lannister back to Kings Landing. The two fighters developed a mutual respect for each other during their journey.
The oldest Stark daughter, Sansa has since realized that King's Landing isn't the fairy tale she assumed it would be.

descriptionSmall: The High Sparrow leads a group of religious zealots.
descriptionLarge: The High Sparrow leads a group of religious zealots determined to combat vice in King's Landing.

Princess of House Targaryen, Daenerys lives in exile in Essos with her advisors and dragons. Dany rallied the Unsullied of Astapor to her cause and continues to grow the army she needs to take back the throne.

Second son to Randyll Tarly, Dickon has interests that are more in line with his father’s. This trait endeared him to Randyll, who forced his brother Sam to renounce his birthright so that Dickon would inherit Horn Hill.

descriptionSmall: Sam was forced to join the Night's Watch...
descriptionLarge: Sam was forced to join the Night's Watch by his father as a means to disinherit him. He fell in love with Craster's daughter Gilly, and fled with her and her newborn son into the wilderness after a band of Night's Watch brothers rebelled at Craster's Keep.
A legendary soldier, Randyll Tarly has no patience for his son Samwell’s studious nature. He forced Sam to join the Night’s Watch, making his second son Dickon heir to Horn Hill.
A legendary wildling leader who supports Mance Rayder, Tormund is a fair and formidable warrior.
Mace Tyrell's only daughter, and Queen of the Seven Kingdoms, Margaery is as clever as she is beautiful.
Matriarch of House Tyrell, Lady Olenna is not shy about sharing her opinions. Although fond of her granddaughter Margaery, she feels less generous toward the men in her family

descriptionSmall: A eunuch and a member of the Small Council.
descriptionLarge: A eunuch and a member of the Small Council, Varys is also a master of disguise. Along with Littlefinger, he is always aware of what goes on in Court.
A mercenary, Bronn joined up with Tyrion Lannister in return for a rich reward. Bronn was knighted for his bravery during the Battle of the Blackwater.

descriptionSmall: The elderly, blind maester of the Night's Watch.
descriptionLarge: The elderly, blind maester of the Night's Watch who is sympathetic to Jon Snow's plight.
Catelyn Stark's younger sister and the wife of Jon Arryn, the former Hand of the King. Both she and Catelyn were raised with Petyr Baelish.

descriptionSmall: Lysa and Jon Arryn's seven-year-old son.
descriptionLarge: Lysa and Jon Arryn's son, he was raised under his mother’s watchful eye.

descriptionSmall: An heir to the Iron Throne with a cruel streak.
descriptionLarge: Over-indulged and cowardly, the young king has a cruel streak, particularly when it comes to those who are vulnerable.
Fair-haired and demure, Myrcella now lives in Dorne as part of a deal her uncle Tyrion made with House Martell to align their houses and keep the princess safe.

descriptionSmall: The youngest of the three Baratheon brothers.
descriptionLarge: The youngest of the three Baratheon brothers, Renly believes he will be a better king than his brother Stannis or his nephew Joffrey. With the backing of his close companion Ser Loras Tyrell, he aims to prove it.

descriptionSmall: King of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros...
descriptionLarge: King of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros and longtime friend of Ned Stark. Robert was engaged to Ned's sister, Lyanna, whose abduction by Prince Rhaegar Targaryen incited Robert's uprising against the throne. When Lyanna died during the war, Robert married Cersei Lannister.

descriptionSmall: A serious man and brother of King Robert Baratheon...
descriptionLarge: A serious man who preferred the solitude of the family seat in Dragonstone to King's Landing, Stannis is still challenging his nephew Joffrey for the Iron Throne. The priestess Melisandre helped him murder his brother Renly and narrow the field of rivals.
Rodrik's nephew, he is captain of Ned's household guard and a trusted friend.
Master-at-arms of Winterfell, he trained the Stark boys to fight.
An actor with a Braavosi traveling company, she plays Cersei Lannister in their production of “The Bloody Hand.”

Lord Beric of Blackhaven, he was tasked by Ned Stark, then Hand of the King, to bring Gregor Clegane to justice. A follower of the Red faith, Beric has been brought back to life several times by Thoros of Myr.

descriptionSmall: The warrior leader of a vast tribe...
descriptionLarge: The warrior leader of a vast tribe of horseman in Essos.

descriptionSmall: A master swordsman from the sea-faring isles of Braavos.
descriptionLarge: A master swordsman from the sea-faring isles of Braavos, he teaches his homeland's unique fighting style, known as Water Dancing.

descriptionSmall: A bastard son of Robert Baratheon.
descriptionLarge: A bastard son of Robert Baratheon, Gendry met and befriended Arya Stark on the road north. Melisandre brought the boy to Dragonstone as a sacrifice for Stannis Baratheon, but Davos Seaworth set him free.
A strong but slow-witted recruit who joined the Watch at the same time as Jon Snow, Grenn initially resented Jon's arrogance. The two became friends when Jon began teaching him swordsmanship.

descriptionSmall: Head of the ruling house of the Iron Islands.
descriptionLarge: Head of the ruling house of the Iron Islands, Balon Greyjoy lost two of his sons in a failed revolt against Robert Baratheon. His only surviving son, Theon, was raised as a ward by the Starks.
Theon's older sister, she is the only child of Balon Greyjoy remaining on the Iron Islands.

descriptionSmall: One of Winterfell's many loyal servants.
descriptionLarge: One of Winterfell's many loyal servants, Hodor is simple-minded and oversized.

descriptionSmall: The fiercely loyal bodyguard of Prince Doran Martell.
descriptionLarge: The fiercely loyal bodyguard of Prince Doran Martell.
A wealthy magister in Pentos who acts as guardian for Viserys and Daenerys.
A wildling from Craster’s Keep, Gilly and her son Sam journeyed south of the Wall under the protection of Sam Tarly.
A Dothraki handmaiden who serves Daenerys and teaches her to speak Dothraki.
Head of House Karstark, his son died at the hands of Jaime Lannister. Karstark’s grief turned to fury when Catelyn Stark set the Kingslayer free.

descriptionSmall: A first cousin of Queen Cersei
descriptionLarge: A first cousin of Queen Cersei, he bears some resemblance to her brother Jaime. Lancel fought bravely during the Battle of the Blackwater and suffered a grave injury defending the city.

descriptionSmall: Father of Cersei, Jaime and Tyrion.
descriptionLarge: Father of Cersei, Jaime and Tyrion, Tywin Lannister is the wealthiest man in the Seven Kingdoms. He serves as the Hand of the King to his grandson Joffrey.
Maester of Winterfell, he is watching over Bran and Rickon in Robb's absence.
A troubadour in the Riverlands who understands the link between fame and politics.
A firm and diplomatic leader, Doran stayed largely neutral in the War of Five Kings.
A prince of Dorne, Oberyn Martell is also a fierce fighter who earned the nickname, the "Red Viper."

descriptionSmall: A prince of Dorne and heir to Doran Martell.
descriptionLarge: A prince of Dorne and heir to Doran Martell, Trystane is engaged to Myrcella Baratheon.

descriptionSmall: Also known as the Hound, a personal bodygaurd of Joffrey.
descriptionLarge: The Hound was the personal bodyguard to King Joffrey and carried out his commands, no matter how monstrous. After abandoning King's Landing during the Battle of the Blackwater, the Hound encountered Arya Stark in the Riverlands and been traveling with her ever since, in the hopes of collecting a ransom from her family.

descriptionSmall: The leader of the Dosh Khaleen...
descriptionLarge: The leader of the Dosh Khaleen, and herself the widow of a great khal, she was among those present when Daenerys ate a stallion’s heart.

descriptionSmall: Mirri Maz Duur is a Lhazareen priestess...
descriptionLarge: Mirri Maz Duur is a Lhazareen priestess and medicine woman.

descriptionSmall: A sworn follower of the Faith of the Seven...
descriptionLarge: A sworn follower of the Faith of the Seven, the septa serves as governess to the Stark daughters.

descriptionSmall: Lord Commander Mormont is father of the exiled Jorah Mormont.
descriptionLarge: The father of the disgraced knight Jorah Mormont and Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, he took Jon Snow under his wing and is training him to lead.
A wildling scout, he travels with an eagle.
Once a brother of the Night’s Watch, Mance abandoned his vows to join the wildlings. He serves as their King Beyond the Wall.
A wildling woman who tried to kidnap Bran, she is now a close friend. She is escorting Rickon Stark to Last Hearth for safekeeping.
Quiet and unassuming, Podrick saved Tyrion’s life at the Battle of the Blackwater and now squires for Brienne of Tarth.

descriptionSmall: The aged Grand maester of King's Landing.
descriptionLarge: The aged maester of King's Landing and a member of the Small Council.

descriptionSmall: A flippant young Night's Watch recruit.
descriptionLarge: A flippant young Night's Watch recruit who is sent to the Wall after being accused of stealing.

descriptionSmall: Trained in the medical arts although not a maester.
descriptionLarge: Although trained in the medical arts, Qyburn was censured by the Citadel for his unauthorized experiments and does not wear the chains of a maester. He joined Brienne of Tarth and Jaime Lannister on their journey to King's Landing and has remained there since.
The younger brother of Balon Greyjoy, he has recently returned to Pyke to take the Salt Throne.
A fighter for Mance Rayder, this wildling is named for his armor of animal, human and giant bones.
A prostitute from the North who journeyed to King's Landing, she now works in Littlefinger's brothel and spies for Varys.

As a member of the Kingsguard under the former king, Aerys Targaryen, Barristan "The Bold" never wavered in his oath to protect. For his commitment, Robert pardoned him and promoted him to Lord Commander.

descriptionSmall: A prostitute who made an immediate impression on Tyrion Lannister.
descriptionLarge: A prostitute who made an immediate impression on Tyrion Lannister, Shae joined him in King's Landing in direct defiance of his father's order to keep her away from court. She serves as Sansa Starks handmaid.

descriptionSmall: The commander of the City Watch.
descriptionLarge: The commander of the City Watch in King's Landing.
Ned's younger brother and First Ranger of the Night's Watch, he is a hero of Jon Snow's.

descriptionSmall: Ned Stark's wife and the sister of Lysa Arryn.
descriptionLarge: The widow of Ned Stark, Cat has been trying to reunite her scattered family while respecting the wishes of her eldest son Robb, King in the North.

descriptionSmall: Lord Eddard of Winterfell and Warden of the North.
descriptionLarge: Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North. The childhood friend of Robert Baratheon, Eddard ("Ned") was a key player in Robert's rebellion, helping to win the throne from the Targaryens. He is married to Catelyn (Tully) Stark.

descriptionSmall: Rickon is the youngest of the Stark children.
descriptionLarge: Rickon, the youngest of the Stark children, is traveling north with Osha. His direwolf is named Shaggydog.

descriptionSmall: Lord of Winterfell and now King in the North.
descriptionLarge: Lord of Winterfell and now King in the North, Robb plans to avenge his father's death and bring his sisters home. His direwolf is named Grey Wind.

A former ward of House Stark, Theon was quick to join his close friend Robb in his rebellion against King Joffrey. But upon returning to Pyke as Robb's envoy, Theon betrayed the family that raised him. He seized Winterfell, but was taken prisoner by Ramsay Snow, who tortured him into renouncing his true identity.

descriptionSmall: A native of Volantis, Talisa is a healer.
descriptionLarge: Although a highborn lady of Volantis, Talisa trained in the medical arts. After meeting on the battlefield, she and Robb Stark were married – breaking a promise he had made to Walder Frey.
Prince of House Targaryen, whose father, the "Mad" King Aerys was usurped by King Robert. Viserys lives in self-exile with his sister Daenerys and is obsessed with regaining his family's throne.
Master-at-arms of Castle Black, it is his job to turn undisciplined recruits into rangers of the Night's Watch.

descriptionSmall: A native of the Free City of Myr.
descriptionLarge: A native of the Free City of Myr and a famous soldier, he has since joined the outlaw group the Brotherhood Without Banners. Although Thoros serves as a priest for the Lord of Light, he is fond of drink.

Brynden is known as “the Blackfish,” due to the strained relationship between him and his older brother Hoster. Alongside Barristan Selmy, Brynden showed great heroism during the War of the Ninepenny Kings, a rebellion in the East that threatened the Seven Kingdoms.
A wildling woman that Jon Snow encountered traveling beyond the Wall, Ygritte is fiercely proud of her free status. Her opinions have clouded Jon’s stance about the Night’s Watch.
